intro: Eremogone drypidea, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It is a low-growing perennial herb that produces small, yellow, dandelion-like flowers. The plant has hairy, narrow leaves that help reduce water loss in its harsh environment. Its fibrous roots allow it to survive in poor, sandy soils. Eremogone drypidea plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing food for local wildlife.
